title: Salmonberry (Rubus spectabilis)
name: salmonberry
rationale: Random Forests best matched the range limitations of salmonberry as it becomes less common moving west through the Aleutian Islands.
description: The salmonberry diagnostic species set consists only of Rubus spectabilis Pursh. Rubus spectabilis is common and widespread throughout the temperate bioclimatic zone within the map domain, where it occurs in forests, along streams, and on mountain slopes. This species also extends into the Aleutian-Kamchatka vegetation region, where it is common on the Alaska Peninsula but becomes increasingly uncommon and then absent moving west through the Aleutian Islands. It also occurs in Pacific coastal stretches of the Alaska-Yukon Southern and Alaska Southwest vegetation regions.
